channel.title: Could use some help with this array

item.title: Could use some help with this array
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Im trying to write a program which records mouse movement and clicks in an array and plays it back to you
Iv already made a movement only 1 using TPointArray

Problems started when i tried to make my own TsomethingArray. i saw this sort of thing on SRL, i know it can be done

[scar]
program New;

type
tmousearray=record
x,y:integer;
left,right:boolean;
end;
var recordedmouse:tmousearray;

function recordmouse:tmousearray;
var i,x,y:integer;
begin
setarraylength(result,1)
repeat
setarraylength(result,i+1)
getmousepos(x,y)
result[i].x:=x
result[i].y:=y
result[i].left:=ismousebuttondown(true)
result[i].right:=ismousebuttondown(false)
i:=i+1
until(isfkeydown(2))
end;

begin
end.
[/scar]

when i compile it i get

[scar]
Failed when compiling
Line 17: [Error] (17:7): Semicolon (’;’) expected in script
[/scar]

line 17 character 7 is
[scar]result[i].x:=x[/scar](just after the [ )

please tell me why its not working

Read full topic
item.source: Could use some help with this array
